title: Auburn Is Streaking to the Final Four
summary: The Tigers beat SEC rival Kentucky in overtime to advance to their first-ever men's basketball Final Four. KANSAS CITY, Mo.-The hottest team in college basketball just got hotter.

title: A Buyer's Market? Hopes Rise With Falling Rates, More Homes for Sale
summary: After a market that favored sellers last year, more favorable conditions are already bringing price cuts and fewer bidding wars. The spring home-buying season is shaping up as the best in years, offering new opportunities after last year's tough housing market drove away many would-be buyers.

title: Trump Officials Try to Defend Plan to Cut Aid to Three Central American Nations
summary: Move to pull funds from El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras in migration fight sparked anger from Democrats, questions about administration's authority. Senior administration officials sought to defend President Trump's proposal to cut foreign aid to three Central American countries he says are complicit in the flow of illegal migrants toward the U.S., following a wave of criticism that the move was counterproductive.

title: Ethiopian, U.S. Investigators Tussle Over Crash Probe
summary: Tension over access to and interpretation of data comes ahead of a preliminary report on what happened to the Boeing plane. Tension is simmering between U.S. and Ethiopian officials as investigators prepare to release in the coming days an interim report about the Boeing Co. 737 MAX jetliner that nose-dived after takeoff from Addis Ababa on March 10, according to people from both countries.

title: Comedian Leads in First Round as Ukraine Votes for President
summary: Volodymyr Zelensky, who plays a teacher-turned-president on TV, is ahead in exit polls, and a runoff appears set for April 21. A comedian with no political experience was poised to win the first round of Ukraine's presidential elections Sunday as disillusionment with the political elite simmers in Europe's second poorest country ahead of a likely runoff vote.

title: New York City Set to Get First Congestion Pricing System in Country
summary: A priority was finding money for the Metropolitan Transportation Authority. New York lawmakers were poised to create a congestion-pricing system in Manhattan, increase taxes on real-estate transactions in New York City and move toward a system of public campaign financing as part of a final $175.5 billion state budget deal.

title: Biden Denies Inappropriate Behavior Toward Women After Allegation
summary: Potential presidential candidate vows to 'listen respectfully' after ex-legislator's account of 2014 event. WASHINGTON-Former Vice President Joe Biden said Sunday he didn't believe he had ever acted inappropriately toward women but would "listen respectfully" to those who said he had, seeking to address a burgeoning controversy as he weighs entering the 2020 Democratic presidential primary.

title: Erdogan's Party Faces Election Setback in Turkey
summary: The country has grappled with rising inflation and unemployment and a battered currency. ANKARA, Turkey-The party of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan appeared set to lose political control of the capital and several other big cities in Sunday's local elections, a rare electoral setback in the Turkish leader's 16-year rule that capped months of growing economic malaise.

title: Chicago Prepares to Elect Its First Black Female Mayor
summary: Preckwinkle, Lightfoot spar over city's future as Jesse Jackson calls for healing. The final days of the historic Chicago mayor's race between two black women have turned so acrimonious that the Rev. Jesse Jackson has called for reconciliation between the two candidates the day after the election.

title: The New York Yankees' Lost Decade
summary: The Bronx Bombers haven't gone a calendar decade without a pennant since the 1910s-and their drought exemplifies modern baseball's landscape. The last dynasty in Major League Baseball started nearly a quarter-century ago, a run of dominance that defined a generation of the game's history. In the 15 seasons between 1995 and 2009, the New York Yankees reached the playoffs 14 times, claimed seven American League pennants and won five World Series.

title: Pope Francis Defends Migrants After Morocco Visit
summary: His comments pushed back against rising anti-immigration sentiment around the world. ABOARD THE PAPAL FLIGHT-Pope Francis ended his two-day visit to Morocco with strong words in defense of migrants, emphasizing one of the main themes of the trip and of his pontificate as he pushed back against rising anti-immigration sentiment around the world.

title: Economist's Path From Academia to Politics
summary: Drawn to prospect of shaping policy, she advised Bernie Sanders in Senate and in 2016. When Stephanie Kelton was a little girl, her godmother, Rose Ann Vuich, the first woman elected to the California State Senate, would take her to the State House in Sacramento to watch floor debates.

title: Can the U.S. Afford Democrats' Bold Promises? Why One Economist Says Yes
summary: Stephanie Kelton is among the most vocal proponents of 'modern monetary theory,' which argues U.S. has room to run up deficits. As Democrats on Capitol Hill and the campaign trail present an array of ambitious and expensive policy proposals, from a Green New Deal to Medicare for All, the question they face most often is, "How will the government pay for it?"

title: The Border Asylum Crisis
summary: A broken asylum system all but guarantees entry if you bring children.. Immigration politics is so polarized that right and left have a veto over any constructive policy. Yet a genuine crisis is building at the southern border as the perverse incentives of U.S. asylum law invite a surge of migrants that is overwhelming border security.

title: Jackpot Junk Science
summary: Scientists say a weed killer is safe, but a judge excludes evidence.. The vagaries of American tort law were on display in San Francisco last week as six jurors decided that Bayer AG is liable for $80.3 million in damages for allegedly causing a Sonoma man's non-Hodgkin lymphoma. The scientific consensus is that Bayer's Roundup herbicide is safe, but the company is now open for looting as it faces lawsuits from some 11,200 similar plaintiffs.

title: The Villain in the Russian Collusion Is Vladimir Putin
summary: Now that the Mueller report has been completed, some of the debilitating partisanship might be toned down and our energy refocused on a real and present danger that should unite us all-Vladimir Putin.. Gerald F. Seib rightly points out that the foremost conclusion of the Mueller report summary is about Russian President Vladimir Putin, not President Trump ("Capital Journal: Mueller Report Clears Trump-but Not Putin," U.S. News, March 26). The bedrock of any democracy is the ability of the citizenry to freely elect its leaders and representatives. Yet the most powerful democracy in the world was unable to thwart the efforts of its most powerful adversary to undermine that very process. Russia's insidious attempt to subvert a presidential election is every bit as threatening as any cyberattack on our infrastructure.

title: Zuckerberg for Regulation
summary: Beware of tech CEOs bearing gifts from government.. Sooner or later you knew it would happen: Big tech would invite government regulation to deflect even greater intervention such as an antitrust breakup.

title: Reparations for Slavery Open Pandora's Box
summary: Sen. Elizabeth Warren is proposing a full on discussion about reparations for slavery. By all means, let's have that discussion. But it must be a serious discussion that addresses in detail to whom reparations should be paid and how.. Regarding Jason Riley's "The Illogic of Slavery Reparations at This Late Date" (Upward Mobility, March 20) and Jay Winik's "Do Abolitionists Owe Reparations?" (op-ed, March 25): Sen. Elizabeth Warren is proposing a full on discussion about reparations for slavery. By all means, let's have that discussion. But it must be a serious discussion that addresses in detail to whom reparations should be paid and how. How much should be paid as recompense? Must a person demonstrate that he is descended from slaves and, if so, what documentation will be required? What about people with fractional slave ancestry-50%, 10%, 0.0001%? What will be the cut-off point for people to identify as descended from slaves? Would a person with fractional ancestry be paid full reparations or only a proportional amount, and what would be the justification? Will there be an income or net-worth test, or is financial success today irrelevant to the question of reparations based on historical suffering?

title: A DiCaprio Approach to Limiting Wildfires
summary: The most effective steps for protecting homes during wildfires involve retrofitting roofs, vent screens and other home features, along with trimming vegetation within 100 feet of homes.. Your editorial "Gavin Newsom's Fire Alarm" (March 25) quotes from my concerns about California Gov. Gavin Newsom's current approach to wildfire policy. My comments were made in conjunction with a report from the Leonardo DiCaprio Foundation-"A New Direction for California Wildfire Policy: Working from the Home Outward" that recommends the governor focus state resources on directly helping California homeowners prepare for wildfire. The findings of our report offer good news not only for Californians, but also for the millions of people across the western U.S. who live next to forests and other ecosystems where fire is an inevitable part of life.

title: Economy Week Ahead: Retail Sales, Durable Goods, Jobs Report
summary: Economists expect payrolls growth to improve.

title: Avenatti vs. Nike: The Showdown That Ensnared a Celebrity Lawyer
summary: Resume Subscription. Over the past year, lawyer Michael Avenatti has intervened in some of the country's most sensational legal stories. He's been involved in adult-film star Stormy Daniels's battle against President Trump, the confirmation of Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh and the sex-abuse case against musician R. Kelly.

title: Prince Charles and the Torturers
summary: As he visits Havana, a new report details the Cuba-backed horrors of Venezuela's regime.. Britain's Prince Charles and his wife, Camilla, thumbed their noses at the victims of Venezuelan atrocities last week with an official trip to Cuba-the first ever by a member of the British royal family.

title: A 'Tiny' Tax on Trades Would Hobble Markets
summary: Intended to halt high-frequency swaps, the levy would discourage low-cost investing.. Democratic lawmakers introduced a bill in March that could be a big disruption to U.S. financial markets. The proposed 0.1% tax on all financial transactions-trades in stocks, bonds, derivatives-may sound small, but it could make markets less stable and hurt small investors.

title: 'Devices and Desires' Review: Social Climbing in a Tudor Style
summary: Born into the minor gentry, Bess of Hardwick rose to become a friend of Queen Elizabeth and, dangerously, Mary, Queen of Scots.. Bess of Hardwick, though little known today, was one of the most remarkable women of the 16th century: determined, brave, attractive (when she chose to be) and richly talented. One wouldn't call her "nice," but then "nice" is not an adjective that one would apply to many notable figures in Tudor England, perhaps indeed to none.

title: Another Panel? Change the Channel
summary: On 'Meet the Pest,' they think they're experts on everything.. I received an email inviting me on a Chicago radio show to comment on an op-ed I'd written for the Journal. I replied thanks but no thanks. I don't think punditically, or care for what passes for punditical thought, and the last thing I wish to do is become a radio or TV pundit. I share the view of Austrian writer Stefan Zweig, who in his 1941 autobiography, "The World of Yesterday," wrote: "It has never been my purpose to convert others to my opinions. It sufficed for me to be permitted to express them, and to express them openly"-in my case, as in Zweig's, to make them known in print.

title: The Right and the Moral High Ground
summary: Today minorities suffer from underdevelopment, not racism. And here, at last, is conservatism's great opportunity.. As many have noted, Donald Trump's presidency is an insurgency. Mr. Trump himself is the quintessential insurgent, doing battle with a disingenuous and entrenched establishment. This was his appeal over a field of more conventional Republican candidates in 2016. But last year's midterm elections were disappointing, and Mr. Trump has gone wanting for political clout in the immigration fight. His successes-a booming economy, tax reform, low unemployment, increased oil production, the abandonment of terrible treaties, new and better trade deals-have brought him little goodwill even from his own party.

title: After Smollett, Chicago's Mayoral Runoff Turns Nasty
summary: The race to succeed Rahm Emanuel pits the Windy City's new left against its old Democratic machine.. The decision by Cook County prosecutors to drop charges against "Empire" actor Jussie Smollett for staging a fake hate crime against himself prompted a fierce response from Mayor Rahm Emanuel and the Chicago Police Department last week. Cook County Board President Toni Preckwinkle, who is running to replace Mr. Emanuel in Tuesday's election, was more circumspect.

title: Beijing's Chilling Imprisonment of a Taiwanese Critic
summary: Communist authorities say Li Ming-che violated domestic law but deny him a citizen's legal rights.. Taipei

title: 'Dumbo' Fails to Take Flight at Box Office
summary: The movie, with budget of $170 million, is likely to be Disney's first flop of the year. LOS ANGELES-Dumbo's first flight in 78 years hit turbulence at the weekend box office.

title: Fake News Runs Wild in India as Elections Loom
summary: Efforts to stop the spread of misinformation are having little effect. NEW DELHI-In India, viral fake news is lighting up Facebook Inc.'s WhatsApp messaging app as the world's biggest democracy prepares for national elections in the coming weeks.

title: Authorities Probe Rape Claim Against NBA Star Kristaps Porzingis
summary: Former Knicks star accused of 2018 sexual assault; Porzingis denied the accusation and referred it to federal authorities to investigate for alleged extortion. The New York Police Department is investigating a woman's allegation that NBA star Kristaps Porzingis raped her last year, a person familiar with the matter said, an accusation that Porzingis denied through his attorney and referred months ago to federal authorities to investigate for alleged extortion.

title: Fewer People Have Doubts About Trump After Mueller, Poll Finds
summary: A significant share of poll respondents say summary doesn't clear the president of wrongdoing. WASHINGTON-The completion of Robert Mueller's investigation of Russian interference in the 2016 election has left fewer Americans with doubts about Donald Trump's presidency, even though a significant share say it hasn't cleared the president of wrongdoing, a new Wall Street Journal/NBC News poll finds.

title: Brokers Fear Proposed Real-Estate Tax Could Deepen Sales Slump in Manhattan Apartments
summary: Number of co-ops and condos sold in first quarter fell 5.2% from year-ago period, WSJ analysis shows. While the New York real-estate industry fretted about the potential impact of new state taxes on expensive real estate, the Manhattan residential market deteriorated further in the first quarter of 2019, as sales slumped to the slowest pace in six years.

title: A Judge Wants to Control PG&E's Dividends
summary: The move by federal judge William Alsup could have consequences for other companies. A federal judge is threatening to prevent PG&E Corp. from resuming dividend payments to shareholders until it reduces its role in sparking California wildfires, an action with little precedent that could have big repercussions for other companies put on probation.

title: Walgreens Isn't Ready to Quit Cigarette Sales Yet
summary: Pharmacy tests tobacco-free stores but CEO says it's not planning to follow rival CVS. Under pressure from federal regulators and some investors, Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc. is testing tobacco-free stores in the U.S., but the pharmacy chain's leader has no plans to quit selling cigarettes entirely.

title: Tech IPOs Could Be Boon for California Budget
summary: Sacramento prepares for new tax revenue from public offering of Lyft and others on horizon. Already flush with revenue from its healthy economy and growing number of high earners, California is expecting a tax windfall from a slate of initial public offerings that began Friday with Lyft Inc.

title: Goldilocks Is Back in the House
summary: Tepid economic data on Friday coupled with a rebound in confidence and a cautious Fed provide a great setup for stock investors in coming months. Our short national nightmare may finally be over.

title: Google Can't Please Everyone
summary: Parent Alphabet has lagged behind other major tech stocks on worries about its dominance of its advertising platform. Google hasn't been clicking for investors lately. In part, that is because there is only so much one of the world's largest and highest-valued companies can do to look small.

title: Care.com Removed Tens of Thousands of Unverified Listings
summary: WSJ investigation had found that hundreds of day-care centers listed on its website as state licensed didn't appear to be. The online child-care marketplace Care.com scrubbed its site of tens of thousands of unverified day-care center listings just before a Wall Street Journal investigation published March 8, an analysis shows.

title: Democrats Woo Farm Belt Voters by Taking Aim at Agriculture Firms
summary: Sen. Warren promises to unwind Bayer's purchase of Monsanto; Sen. Klobuchar offers more cautious approach. STORM LAKE, Iowa-Democratic presidential candidates pitched voters in this farm-heavy state on their plans to stir up competition in the agriculture industry and stem the consolidation of corporate power in the U.S.

title: Apple News+ Is Great for Magazine Lovers, But It's Not the Future of News
summary: An Apple Inc.'s News+ subscription brings you content from magazines and other publications, including this one-but there are serious limitations. In some ways, Apple News+, the company's new all-you-can-read news and magazine subscription service, feels like the same idea that powered the Kindle and even the original iPod. Take a bunch of physical things-books or CDs-and make them available en masse on a single device.

title: Crypto Fundraising Slows Markedly
summary: The market for initial coin offerings, which boomed last year, has ground to a halt. The ICO market is dead. Just about, anyway.

title: China's Riskiest Dollar Bonds Are Surging
summary: Issues that drove Chinese bond prices lower last year, such as heightened U.S.-China trade concerns, have receded for now. A fear gauge for the junk bond market has receded.

title: New Social Rules Leave Saudis Confused About How to Behave
summary: Youth test limits as crown prince dismantles taboos and conservatives push to enforce old ways. JEDDAH, Saudi Arabia-Alert Specialty Coffee symbolized this kingdom's changing culture when it opened around 18 months ago. Saudi baristas wearing skinny jeans whipped up lattes while up-tempo music played and men and women mingled freely.

title: Too Volatile, or Too Calm, Markets Still Aren't Just Right for Wall Street
summary: A decline in Cboe's volatility index hurts trading results, but banks avoid further layoffs. Markets have been calm so far in 2019. That's bad news for Wall Street trading desks.

title: Debt Investors at a Crossroads as Fed Pivots
summary: Bond demand is high, but observers aren't sure if central bank's move merits caution. Investors piled into bonds in the first few months of 2019, buying everything from Treasurys to riskier corporate debt as a newly supportive Federal Reserve eased concerns about rising interest rates and the potential for a near-term recession.

title: 'Fear of Missing Out' Pushes Investors Toward Stocks
summary: As major indexes continue to rise toward last year's records, investors say they are increasingly wary of missing further gains. Investors are putting more money into U.S. stocks as 2019's rebound continues, a shift that some analysts expect to drive markets higher despite the recent rally in government bonds and an expected slowdown in economic growth.

title: Stocks Just Jumped, But Investors Aren't in the Clear
summary: Some stock-market watchers feel they're back at square one after early 2019 surge. Stock investors have been on a wild ride the past six or so months: The S&P 500 has gone from a record high, to being on the cusp of a bear market, to being back within striking distance of its recent peak.

title: Sizing Up Stocks' Big First-Quarter Rally
summary: Issues that helped push markets higher in the first quarter could now prove to be stumbling blocks. Investors hoping for stocks' rally to keep up the first quarter's pace may be headed for a disappointment.

title: China Manufacturing Gauge Rebounds
summary: The official manufacturing PMI rose to 50.5 in March from 49.2 in February. BEIJING-An official gauge of activity in China's crucial manufacturing sector rebounded strongly in March, suggesting that Beijing's support policies are gaining traction.

title: In Europe's Nationalist Hotbed, Slovakia Takes a Liberal Turn
summary: Zuzana Caputova, an environmental lawyer, is elected as first female president. Slovakia elected its first female president, a liberal and pro-European anticorruption candidate whose rise is seen as a rebuke of the conservative nationalism remaking its larger neighbors.

title: Virginia Outlasts Purdue to Head to Final Four
summary: Cavaliers win 80-75 in overtime of the South Regional final on Saturday night. LOUISVILLE, Ky.-It took a miracle buzzer-beater but Virginia (33-3) is headed to the Final Four.

title: Texas Tech's Defense Trips Up Gonzaga
summary: Red Raiders upset No. 1 seed to secure their first-ever trip to the Final Four. Texas Tech is creating the best days in its men's basketball program's history in real time. It's doing it with a defense that no team in the NCAA tournament has been able to solve.

title: Facebook Chief Mark Zuckerberg Wants More Internet Regulation
summary: 'People shouldn't have to rely on individual companies' to address issues such as privacy and hate speech, Zuckerberg says in op-ed. Facebook Inc. Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg called for global regulators to take a "more active role" in governing the internet, among his strongest remarks yet on regulation that come after more than a year of intense scrutiny over missteps at the social network.
